page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
This area is entirely rural. It consists of gently rolling farmland, largely grassland. There are a fair number of hedges and trees, but no woods. Although the area is close to the city of Leicester, it recieves few visitors, as it is not of outstanding beauty.
There are two villages, Peatling Magna (Peatling), and Willoughby Waterleys (Willoughby). They have few facilities, apart from a church and a pub each.
Each village has a mixture of inhabitants; farmers and farm workers, retired people, workers who commute to Leicester, and fairly wealthy people who live in the large houses in the villages.
